title: nbaplotR • Plot NBA Team Logos
text: goal nbaplotR provide functions geoms help visualization NBA related analysis. provides ggplot2 geom heavy lifting plotting NBA logos high quality, correct aspect ratio possible transparency.

what: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing NBA Team Logos — geom_nba_logos
title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing NBA Team Logos — geom_nba_logos
text: geom used plot NBA team logos instead points ggplot. requires x, y aesthetics well valid NBA team abbreviation. latter can checked valid_team_names().

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing NBA Team Logos — geom_nba_logos
code: geom_nba_logos(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = FALSE,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing NBA Team Logos — geom_nba_logos
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes() aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). stat statistical transformation use data layer, string. position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. ... arguments passed ggplot2::layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value. See section "Aesthetics" full list possible arguments. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders().

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing NBA Team Logos — geom_nba_logos
text: ggplot2 layer (ggplot2::layer()) can added plot created ggplot2::ggplot().

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing NBA Team Logos — geom_nba_logos
text: geom_nba_logos() understands following aesthetics (required aesthetics bold): x - x-coordinate. y - y-coordinate. team_abbr - team abbreviation. one valid_team_names(). function tries clean team names internally calling nflreadr::clean_team_abbrs() alpha = NULL - alpha channel, .e. transparency level, numerical value 0 1. colour = NULL - image colorized colour. Use special character "b/w" set black white. information valid colour names ggplot2 see https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/articles/ggplot2-specs.html?q=colour#colour--fill angle = 0 - angle image numerical value 0° 360°. hjust = 0.5 - horizontal adjustment relative given x coordinate. Must numerical value 0 1. vjust = 0.5 - vertical adjustment relative given y coordinate. Must numerical value 0 1. width = 1.0 - desired width image npc (Normalised Parent Coordinates). default value set 1.0 big necessary used values computed relative default. typical size width = 0.075 (see examples). height = 1.0 - desired height image npc (Normalised Parent Coordinates). default value set 1.0 big necessary used values computed relative default. typical size height = 0.1 (see examples).

title: ggplot2 Layer for Visualizing NBA Team Logos — geom_nba_logos
code: # \donttest{ library(nbaplotR) library(ggplot2)  team_abbr <- nbaplotR::valid_team_names()  df <- data.frame(   a = rep(1:8, 4),   b = sort(rep(1:4, 8), decreasing = TRUE),   teams = team_abbr ) #> Error in data.frame(a = rep(1:8, 4), b = sort(rep(1:4, 8), decreasing = TRUE),     teams = team_abbr): arguments imply differing number of rows: 32, 30  # keep alpha == 1 for all teams including an "A" matches <- grepl("A", team_abbr) df$alpha <- ifelse(matches, 1, 0.2) #> Error in df$alpha <- ifelse(matches, 1, 0.2): object of type 'closure' is not subsettable # also set a custom fill colour for the non "A" teams df$colour <- ifelse(matches, NA, "gray") #> Error in df$colour <- ifelse(matches, NA, "gray"): object of type 'closure' is not subsettable  # scatterplot of all logos ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)) +   geom_nfl_logos(aes(team_abbr = teams), width = 0.075) +   geom_label(aes(label = teams), nudge_y = -0.35, alpha = 0.5) +   theme_void() #> Error in ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)):   You're passing a function as global data. #>   Have you misspelled the `data` argument in `ggplot()`  # apply alpha via an aesthetic from inside the dataset `df` # please note that you have to add scale_alpha_identity() to use the alpha # values in your dataset! ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)) +   geom_nba_logos(aes(team_abbr = teams, alpha = alpha), width = 0.075) +   geom_label(aes(label = teams), nudge_y = -0.35, alpha = 0.5) +   scale_alpha_identity() +   theme_void() #> Error in ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)):   You're passing a function as global data. #>   Have you misspelled the `data` argument in `ggplot()`  # apply alpha and colour via an aesthetic from inside the dataset `df` # please note that you have to add scale_alpha_identity() as well as # scale_color_identity() to use the alpha and colour values in your dataset! ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)) +   geom_nba_logos(aes(team_abbr = teams, alpha = alpha, colour = colour), width = 0.075) +   geom_label(aes(label = teams), nudge_y = -0.35, alpha = 0.5) +   scale_alpha_identity() +   scale_color_identity() +   theme_void() #> Error in ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)):   You're passing a function as global data. #>   Have you misspelled the `data` argument in `ggplot()`  # apply alpha as constant for all logos ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)) +   geom_nba_logos(aes(team_abbr = teams), width = 0.075, alpha = 0.6) +   geom_label(aes(label = teams), nudge_y = -0.35, alpha = 0.5) +   theme_void() #> Error in ggplot(df, aes(x = a, y = b)):   You're passing a function as global data. #>   Have you misspelled the `data` argument in `ggplot()`  # }
